text: Comparison of 1440p resolutions Resolution Display aspect ratio Megapixels 5120 × 1440 3.:1 (32:9) 7.37 3440 × 1440 2.3:1 (43:18) 4.95 3200 × 1440 2.:1 (20:9) 4.61 3120 × 1440 2.1:1 (39:18) 4.49 3040 × 1440 2.:1 (19:9) 4.38 2960 × 1440 2.0:1 (37:18) 4.2699 2880 × 1440 2:1 (18:9) 4.15 2560 × 1440 1.:1 (16:9) 3.69 2304 × 1440 1.6:1 (16:10) 3.32 2160 × 1440 1.5:1 (3:2) 3.11 1920 × 1440 1.:1 (4:3) 2.76 1440p is a family of video display resolutions that have a vertical resolution of 1440 pixels. The 1440 pixel vertical resolution is double the vertical resolution of 720p, and one-third more than 1080p. 1440p is commonly used in smartphone screens, and for computer and console gaming as a cheaper alternative to 4K. Category:Display technology
title: 1440p
